ARABIC: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: he would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are raised again.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He would have stayed in its belly till the day the dead are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: he would certainly have remained inside the fish until the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He would have remained in its belly till the day when all will be raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He would certainly have tarried in its belly to the day when they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: he would have tarried in its belly until the day they shall be raised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are raised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: he would certainly have remained inside the fish till the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He would have tarried in the belly thereof till the Day when they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: he would have surely remained in its belly till the day they will be resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He would certainly have remained inside the Fish till the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: he would have lingered in its belly till the Day they are resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He would have stayed in its belly until the Day they are raised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:144] he would have tarried in its belly until the day when they are raised, in other words, the whale’s belly would have been his tomb until the Day of Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 516 (He would have tarried in its belly) he would have remained in the belly of the fish (till the day when they are raised) from the graves;
